The class {{tt|std::locale::id}} provides implementation-specific identification of a locale facet. Each {{rlp|facet}} has a public static member named {{ttb|id}} of type {{tt|std::locale::id}} and each {{lc|std::locale}} object maintains a list of facets it implements, indexed by their {{tt|id}}s.

Facets with the same {{tt|id}} belong to the same facet category and replace each other when added to a locale object.

===Example===
{{example
|The following example shows how to construct a minimal custom facet.
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;locale&gt;

struct myfacet : std::locale::facet
{
    myfacet(std::size_t refs = 0) : facet(refs) {}
    static ::std::locale::id id;
};

std::locale::id myfacet::id;

int main()
{
    std::locale myloc(std::locale(), new myfacet);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "has_facet&lt;myfacet&gt;(myloc) returns " &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha
              &lt;&lt; std::has_facet&lt;myfacet&gt;(myloc) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
has_facet&lt;myfacet&gt;(myloc) returns true
}}
